blocks.text: A DBMS is made up of several key components that work together to manage data efficiently:

list: Database Engine: Core service for storing, retrieving, and updating data.
Query Processor: Interprets and executes SQL queries.
Storage Manager: Handles storage, indexing, and retrieval of data on disk.
Transaction Manager: Ensures all database transactions are processed reliably and follow ACID properties.
Metadata Catalog: Stores information about database structure and schema.
Backup & Recovery Manager: Maintains data integrity and helps recover data in case of failure.

blocks.text: Letâ€™s briefly understand ACID properties which are crucial for transaction management:

list: Atomicity: Either all operations of a transaction are performed or none.
Consistency: Database moves from one valid state to another after a transaction.
Isolation: Concurrent transactions do not interfere with each other.
Durability: Once a transaction is committed, it will remain so even in case of a system failure.

blocks.title: Summary
blocks.text: Understanding DBMS components is the foundation for learning advanced topics like SQL queries, NoSQL databases, indexing, and replication.
With this knowledge, you're ready to dive into database models, SQL basics, and more advanced DBMS concepts.
